seg.seg: ... having moved (?) the sky. We pay homage to you for having gone away from the house (wishing for) the rank of a Buddha
... we pay (respect) to you. May you not forget us, may you deliver us from all woes!
May you not forget us, may you deliver us from all woes! (165)
... (God Brahmā), having looked (at the noble Metrak), says to God Indra: See, Kauśika, very much now the noble Metrak
... has become to be seen similar to ..., very well is he now equipped with the guise of a monk. || God Indra says:
... having become ﬁlled with joy, he constantly says the praise of the noble Metrak, and constantly
... Thereupon, leaving out Paiṅgika, the fourteen brahmin youths, beginning with Ajita,
... altogether. They, out of love for the venerable noble Metrak and ... (with) the threefold refuge(-taking)
... Paiṅgika, the brahmin youth, having attained the rank of a srotaāpanna (and having) respectfully (asked) the Buddha-god the teacher
... (he) is going to the Dakṣiṇāpatha. Exit Paiṅgika. || Thereupon, the venerable Buddha-god the teacher, (having called) ... beginning with the noble Metrak, ...
... Good is your coming, oh monks! Good is the going away from the house! Good is your obtaining
... At some time, somewhere, like the Udumbara flower, the Buddha-god the teacher makes his appearance.
... if you have attained ..., be sure to have become those who have always accumulated virtue with body, word, and mind, oh monks!
… if you attain [pl.] …, be [pl.] sure to have always accumulated virtue with body, word, and mind, o monks! (cf 139)
... this way to the Nirvāṇa, oh sages! 1 || Therefore go, you monks, ... (for) your own good
... I will [go and save] the adherents of the Vinaya, beginning with Urubilvā-Kāśyapa. That having been said,
I will [go and save] the adherents of the Vinaya, beginning with Urubilvā-Kāśyapa. (139)
... The second act (of the Maitreyasamiti-Nāṭaka) named Maitreya-pravrajana has come to an end. || This book
... as fruit of merits ... may I for sure come together with the Buddha-god Metrak! ||

p.note: This fragment contains the end and colophon (in b7) of the second act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami II, 17a1-b25. See also 195-6.
The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 142.

/// [_k]_l_a tk· ākā_ś\: this reading appears to be preferable to [r]utk(·) ākā_ś\ of 138. Possibly, this sequence is to interpreted as /// klä tka[ṃ] ākāś '... earth [and] sky.' (: xx). Although 280 has correctly noted the difficulties with the reading, he leaves out the second akṣara completely in his own suggestion /// (ka)[_k]_l_a(ṃ) ākā_ś\.

ākāś is the last word of the ﬁrst pāda of the second stanza of the type 4 x 18 (7/7/4). For wināsamäśśi etc. cf. the Uyghur text in the Turfan recension, Taf. 18, v. 14 fr. (59) and in the Hami recension, MaitrHami 2, 17 a2ff.

The subject of träṅkäṣ is in the singular, whereas in the Uyghur version the praise to the noble Metrak is done by the divine beings in the sky, cf. MaitrHami 2, 17 a18-20, and in the Turfan recension, Taf. 19, r. 4-6 (60).
śaraṇagamyo: for this expression, cf. : a8, and : a6.
Cf. MaitrHami 2, 17 b1. The akṣara tka in tkäṣṣi had been left out by the scribe, and is written in smaller size beneath the line.
The forms TA kakmu, lantu, and kälpo are verbal nouns, not past participles; kāsu kakmu corresponds to Skt. svāgatam 'good coming'.
For this syntagma (pñintwiss oko, pñintwāśśi oko), cf. : b5, : b2, : a1.
